meanings.definition: Of, relating to, or having the shape of an ogive.
meanings.sent1: The ogival roof of the house added a unique touch to its design.
meanings.sent2: The artist used an ogival pattern to decorate the walls of the cathedral.
meanings.sent3: The ogival windows made the castle look like a fairytale palace.
meanings.sent4: Her dress flowed gracefully, resembling the ogival curves of a Gothic arch.
meanings.sent5: The ogival shape of the mountain peak stood out against the clear blue sky.

meanings.definition: A pointed arch or rib in Gothic architecture.
meanings.sent1: The cathedral's beauty was enhanced by the intricate ogival arches.
meanings.sent2: Visitors marveled at the grandeur of the ogival windows in the old church.
meanings.sent3: The ogival arches in the castle seemed to reach for the sky.
meanings.sent4: The ogival ribs of the ceiling resembled the skeleton of a giant creature.
meanings.sent5: The ogival doorway led to a mysterious chamber within the ancient ruins.
